data.title: Great time
data.text: We have taken several groups of people back to this intimate cozy cafe.  Great service and food.  On a really hot night it's has the best air conditioning in downtown Kirkland.  They were very accommodating when we made reservations for a taste tour.

data.title: Wonderful lunch
data.text: As a threesome we enjoyed a fantastic lunch at Lilac Cafe. The menu was unique, and the attention to the preparation of the food was impressive. All three of us ordered very different types of dishes. One was a burger and fries (unusual preparation with brie and fried shallots), one was chicken piccata, and my order was lamb shank with grilled polenta. Excellent presentation and value. Attentive service.  I would go back there anytime.

data.title: Love, love, love
data.text: For our first visit, we and another couple went to Lilac Cafe for Happy Hour on Wednesday at 4:30. We were the only people in the restaurant at this time but I don't know why -- talk about a wonderful dining experience. Wow! Just wow! We were greeted warmly and our server was delightful. The decor was casual but tasteful and inviting. We wanted to try everything on the Happy Hour menu (specialty drinks as well as food items) AND their specials for the evening. However, since that wasn't possible I had a Grapefruit martini -- excellent; the others had craft beer and wine. Our food choices, which we shared, were: caesar salad; the 3 sampler sliders (pork belly, salmon, bacon cheeseburger); salmon quesadilla (out of this world);  special for the night, 4 cheese ravioli with sage butter sauce (also out of this world); steamed mussels in a marvelous broth; lovely dinner rolls to sop up the mussel broth. I want to go back to try other menu options. Highly recommend for a wonderful dining experience. Please go; I want the Lilac Cafe to stick around for a long time.

data.title: What a great surprise
data.text: Just fabulous...The food was amazing and the atmosphere was quiet and perfect for relaxing and enjoying each other. We could not believe the value for the quality of the plate. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone who is serious about food.

data.title: Worth a Second Try.
data.text: We joined a group of 20 people for a dinner and with the exception of the food temperature not being warm enough for my taste the food was nicely prepared and a delightful selection. The cocktails (excellent Cosmo) and wine selections were fine, I lived the small bistro vibe. We started with the Butternut Squash Sour which was plentiful and tasty though I would have preferred it warner and also the Spinach Salad which included mushrooms and red onions. For our entrée I had the Pork Chop which I thought was a bit over cooked, I also would have preferred a thinker cut of meat and the Salmon, it was perfectly prepared though would have preferred it warmer. We ended the evening with the Crème Brule which was excellent. The staff was attentive to our requests. This restaurant is small and having all of us there at the same time I think put unnecessary pressure on the kitchen staff, I would definitely try Lilac Café again the pluses outshined the minuses.

data.title: A new gem in Kirkland
data.text:
Looks are deceiving.  The previous restaurant was not impressive and I fear people do not know it's now one of Lynn's places.  It's a casual alternative to Lynn's Bistro next door.  Small bites and mostly a la carte.  The wine selection is excellent.  The signature cocktails are yummy.  You have to try the fried truffle polenta.  It's like a giant french fry but warm and creamy polenta inside.  The Caesar dressing is perfect and pairs well with the tenderloin tips.  Happy hour til 7 is a great deal.  Typically not crowded but if there are more than four of you, best to reserve a spot.  
Cool thing is you can see right into the tiny kitchen where the two chef's slave away.  The bar area is compact, but has a tv for sports.  If that's not your vibe, the other side of the space has a wall dividing it and you don't even know the bar is there.
The only negative is that it's very dark inside with the purple and black theme and dark floors, but the food completely overcomes the decor.

data.title: Excellent companion to Lynn's Bistro
data.text: Lilac Cafe is the new little cousin to Lynn's Bistro next door. Serving smaller plates in an intimate atmosphere, it's a fine new addition to the Kirkland restaurant scene. Service was friendly and prompt, and the food is excellent.

data.title: Great for happy hour and small plates
data.text: If you like Lynn's Bistro (owner of Lilac Cafe) and the happy hour at Trellis restaurant, you will definitely enjoy Lilac Cafe.  They have a very nice happy hour menu from 4-7, with additional choices on their small plates menu (prices much llke Trellis happy hour).  One especially good salad is the melon salad with goat cheese, arugula, and proscuitto.  On happpy hour it is $9.00.  Those who enjoy polenta will love their polenta fries, little stacked logs of gently deep fried polenta.   The crab tower was not as good as that offered at Coho Cafe.  Happy hour wines are $2.00 off regular price (with an optional white/red happy hour wine selection).  The quality of the food is definitely there.  One caution:  make certain to check your bill.  Our waiter tried twice to offer us something we hadn't ordered (which we politely refused) but it showed up on the bill anyway.  This along with the fact he didn't offer happy hour prices on 2-3 of the items made us wonder? Honest mistake?  Probably . . .but check your bill!.  This spot is a definite repeater.

data.title: The perfect meeting place for a relaxed informal evening
data.text: From Lynn's Bistro next door comes...  Lilac Café!  For smaller bites, and a gathering place for good friends and great company, with European charm and ambience, this is another find.  There is more than sufficient selection to satisfy choices of seafood, white meat, and red meat.  Finally, if you want just a nice enjoyable meal, but with a more petite appetite than the full course at Lynn's, there is the a la carte with sufficient variety for different tastes.  Perfect night out for couples or a great place to catch up on connections.
